body.p:
R. H. STANTON.
THOS. J. THROOP.
STANTON & THROOP,
ATTORNEYS AT LAW,
MAYSVILLE, KY.
Will Practice in Mason and adjoining Counties, also in District and Federal Courts and Courts of Appeals.
Collections in any part of Northern Kentucky will receive prompt attention.

I wrote you last week that the Governor, remittition for Wm H. Ingram's fine of $50 -- found against him at our last July Term had not been recd You will reccollect that you told me, when I saw you in Frankfort this fall, that the fine had been remitted, & the paper sent, The pardon for the imprisonment under judgt of a Justice of the Peace, was recd but not until after he had served out the full term,

He is now trying to do better, & if he
has this fine, inflicted at the July Term to pay, it will have to be paid by his wife, who has owed two hundred dollars, all that is left of a very handsome estate,

If the Governor has not remitted this fine, please urge him to do so, as a personal favor to me, & if he has done so, please send it to me immediately, Your early reply & immediate attention will greatly oblige

Mason Cir. ct
$50
Wm H. Ingram
Issd Jany 12. 1861
Fine remitted
B. M
